BETA Program Presentation

Here is an example of how to present piece of a BETA program, using <PRE class=beta>.
The markup of existing BETA files can be done using doc/bin/beta2html/perl like this: perl beta2html.perl *.bet. This will generate an HTML file for each BETA file.
Notice that the program below will only show background color, border and indentation in CSS aware browsers. For instance not in netscape 3.0.

There is an official W3C HTML tag called <OBJECT> which can be used for including other HTML files into a HTML file. The following is a usage of this feature:

However, since this tag is not yet widely supported by browsers (e.g. not by Netscape), for now we will have to include the HTML directly into the source as below:

Hello.bet

ORIGIN '~beta/basiclib/betaenv';
(* The classical "Hello, World" program in BETA *)
--PROGRAM: descriptor--
(# 
do 'Hello, World!' -> Screen.PutLine;
   'Goodbye, World!' -> Screen.PutLine;
#)
Here is another example, where focus is on the fragment structure. It uses a table with class=beta, and the code inside <TD> is set with <PRE> (and not class=beta!). This is necessary to make it look reasonable in non-CSS aware browsers, like Netscape 3.0.

fragment.bet
NAME 'textlib'
ORIGIN 'betaenv'
INCLUDE 'mylib'
LIB: attributes
SpreadText:
  (* A blank is inserted between all chars in the text 'T' *)
  (# T: @text
  enter T
  <<SLOT SpreadText:DoPart>>
  exit T
  #);
BreakIntoLines:
  (* 'T' refers to a text which is to be split into lines. *)
  (* 'w' is the width of the lines. *)
  (# T: ^ Text; w: @ Integer
  enter(T[],w)
  <<SLOT BreakIntoLines: DoPart>>
  #)
